intro: Marilaunidium rothrockii, commonly known as the Rothrock's marilaunidium, is a rare and specialized plant native to the Appalachian region of the United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky stream banks and forest floors. Its small, white flowers bloom in late spring, and it produces distinctive, elongated fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
